sect1.title: Listener Configuration
sect1.para:
The listener configuration is defined in the Listener section. The listener specifies the set of accepted connections and their attributes. It also defines some global settings listed in the following table:
Global listener settings
Name Description
MaxConnections The maximum number of total simultaneous connections (clients). When set to 0 then the default is used. The Default is the operating system limit.
Threads Number of threads for serving client connections
Here is an example configuration of the global settings:
Listener { MaxConnections 12 Threads 7 }
The listener allows 2 different types of connections to configure. The types are also the section names where they are configured in the listener configuration. One is Socket that describes a plain connection. The other is SslSsocket that describes a connection with transport layer encryption based on SSL/TLS. In the following 2 sections they are introduced:

sect2.title: Socket
sect2.para:
In subsections Socket of the section Listener of the configuration we describe plain connections based on TCP. The follwing table describes the attributes you can set for plain TCP connections:
Socket settings
Name Description
Address Listening address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the server. '127.0.0.1' and '::1' stand for the loopback address (IPv4 an IPv6 respectively). The listener wildcards '*' or '0.0.0.0'/'::' (IPv4 or IPv6) are also accepted.
Port Connection port
Identifier Identifier that can be reference in authorization functions to classify connections and do authorization based on it.
MaxConnections The maximum number of simultaneus connections for this port.
The following configuration shows an example plain TCP connection definition:
Listener { Socket { Address localhost Port 7661 Identifier "Interface 1" } }

sect2.title: SslSocket
sect2.para:
In subsections SslSocket of the section Listener of the configuration we describe connections connection with transport layer encryption based on SSL/TLS. The follwing table describes the attributes you can set for SSL/TLS connections. The first 4 attributes are the same as for TCP/IP plain:
SslSocket settings
Name Description
Address Listening address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the server. '127.0.0.1' and '::1' stand for the loopback address (IPv4 an IPv6 respectively). The listener wildcards '*' or '0.0.0.0'/'::' (IPv4 or IPv6) are also accepted.
Port Connection port
Identifier Identifier that can be reference in authorization functions to classify connections and do authorization based on it.
MaxConnections The maximum number of simultaneus connections for this port.
Certificate File with the SSL certificate
Key File with the SSL key
CAdirectory Directory holding the CA certificate files
CAchainFile SSL CA chain file
Verify ON/OFF switch to enabe/disable client certificate verification
The following configuration shows an example SSL connection definition:
Listener { SslSocket { Address localhost Port 7961 Identifier "Interface 1" MaxConnections 2 Certificate SSL/wolframed.crt key SSL/wolframed.key CAchainFile SSL/CAchain.pem Verify Off } }
